subject: p15438386
History: Difficulty swallowing pills, now presenting with cough. Concern for aspiration.
Findings: AP and lateral chest radiographs demonstrate very low lung volumes and probable bibasilar opacities, likely atelectasis, though consolidation cannot be excluded. Bilateral small pleural effusions are also present. The cardiomediastinal silhouette appears widened due to low lung volumes. There is no pneumothorax. Old right mid clavicular fracture is noted.
